Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: The temporal profile considers average and standard deviation of times between pairs of activities that follow each other in process executions. For trace <A,B,C,D>, pairs like (A,B), (A,C), and (A,D) are considered.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: The global supply chain process involves sequential activities SS, OP, RC, QI, CA, PT, PK, WS, DT, AS. These are connected with possible delays that I estimate based on supply chain dynamics.

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - IND
Text: For example, SS to OP might take 5 days with a 1-day standard deviation. Similarly, other consecutive activities like OP-RC or RC-QI are assigned plausible times based on context.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Using the idea of process execution, I extend the temporal profile to non-consecutive pairs by summing the average times and variances of intermediate steps.

Name: Validation - IND
Text: For non-consecutive pairs, I validated the approach by calculating aggregate times and standard deviations using the sum of individual averages and variances.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - NE
Text: Assuming linearity of the supply chain process, I concluded that intermediate times can always be summed to derive non-consecutive pair delays. However, this may oversimplify parallel or overlapping activities.

Name: Backtracking - PE
Text: I revised calculations to ensure consistent treatment of variances for non-consecutive pairs like SS-QI or SS-PT.

Name: Ethical or Moral Reasoning - IND
Text: Ensuring transparency in reasoning, I acknowledged assumptions and highlighted potential inaccuracies due to lack of actual data.
